maml:description.maml:para: Add-OBSInput : CreateInput
Creates a new input, adding it as a scene item to the specified scene.
Add-OBSInput calls the OBS WebSocket with a request of type CreateInput.
Name of the scene to add the input to as a scene item
UUID of the scene to add the input to as a scene item
Name of the new input to created
The kind of input to be created
Settings object to initialize the input with
Whether to set the created scene item to enabled or disabled
If set, will return the information that would otherwise be sent to OBS.
If set, will not attempt to receive a response from OBS. This can increase performance, and also silently ignore critical errors
The kind of input to be created

Add-OBSSceneCollection : CreateSceneCollection

Clears a Scene in OBS
Clears a Scene in OBS.
All inputs will be removed from the scene.
This cannot be undone, so you will be prompted for confirmation.
Name of the scene.
Name of the scene.
Connects to Open Broadcast Studio
Connects to the obs-websocket.
This must occur at least once to use obs-powershell.
The OBS websocket URL. If not provided, this will default to loopback on port 4455.
A randomly generated password used to connect to OBS. You can see the websocket password in Tools -> obs-websocket settings -> show connect info

Copy-OBSSceneItem : DuplicateSceneItem
Duplicates a scene item, copying all transform and crop info.

Get-OBSCurrentPreviewScene : GetCurrentPreviewScene
Gets the current preview scene.
Only available when studio mode is enabled.
Note: This request is slated to have the `currentPreview`-prefixed fields removed from in an upcoming RPC version.
Get-OBSCurrentPreviewScene calls the OBS WebSocket with a request of type GetCurrentPreviewScene.
If set, will return the information that would otherwise be sent to OBS.
If set, will not attempt to receive a response from OBS. This can increase performance, and also silently ignore critical errors
If set, will not attempt to receive a response from OBS. This can increase performance, and also silently ignore critical errors
If set, will return the information that would otherwise be sent to OBS.

Gets OBS Effects
Gets effects currently loaded into OBS-PowerShell.
An effect can be thought of as a name with a series of messages to OBS.
Those messages can be defined in a .json file or a script, in any module that tags OBS.
They can also be defined in a function or script named like:
* `*.OBS.Effect.*`
* `*.OBS.Effects.*`
The name of the effect.
The name of the effect.

Get-OBSGroup : GetGroupList
Gets an array of all groups in OBS.
Groups in OBS are actually scenes, but renamed and modified. In obs-websocket, we treat them as scenes where we can.
Get-OBSGroup calls the OBS WebSocket with a request of type GetGroupList.
If set, will return the information that would otherwise be sent to OBS.
If set, will not attempt to receive a response from OBS. This can increase performance, and also silently ignore critical errors
If set, will not attempt to receive a response from OBS. This can increase performance, and also silently ignore critical errors
If set, will return the information that would otherwise be sent to OBS.
Get-OBSGroupSceneItem : GetGroupSceneItemList
Basically GetSceneItemList, but for groups.
Using groups at all in OBS is discouraged, as they are very broken under the hood. Please use nested scenes instead.
Groups only
Get-OBSGroupSceneItem calls the OBS WebSocket with a request of type GetGroupSceneItemList.

Get-OBSHotkey : GetHotkeyList
Gets an array of all hotkey names in OBS.

Note: Hotkey functionality in obs-websocket comes as-is, and we do not guarantee support if things are broken. In 9/10 usages of hotkey requests, there exists a better, more reliable method via other requests.
Get-OBSHotkey calls the OBS WebSocket with a request of type GetHotkeyList.
If set, will return the information that would otherwise be sent to OBS.

Get-OBSSourceScreenshot : GetSourceScreenshot
Gets a Base64-encoded screenshot of a source.
The `imageWidth` and `imageHeight` parameters are treated as "scale to inner", meaning the smallest ratio will be used and the aspect ratio of the original resolution is kept.
If `imageWidth` and `imageHeight` are not specified, the compressed image will use the full resolution of the source.
**Compatible with inputs and scenes.**
Get-OBSSourceScreenshot calls the OBS WebSocket with a request of type GetSourceScreenshot.
Name of the source to take a screenshot of
UUID of the source to take a screenshot of
Image compression format to use. Use `GetVersion` to get compatible image formats
Width to scale the screenshot to
Height to scale the screenshot to
Compression quality to use. 0 for high compression, 100 for uncompressed. -1 to use "default" (whatever that means, idk)
If set, will return the information that would otherwise be sent to OBS.
If set, will not attempt to receive a response from OBS. This can increase performance, and also silently ignore critical errors
Compression quality to use. 0 for high compression, 100 for uncompressed. -1 to use "default" (whatever that means, idk)
Image compression format to use. Use `GetVersion` to get compatible image formats
Height to scale the screenshot to
Width to scale the screenshot to
If set, will not attempt to receive a response from OBS. This can increase performance, and also silently ignore critical errors
If set, will return the information that would otherwise be sent to OBS.
Name of the source to take a screenshot of
UUID of the source to take a screenshot of

Save-OBSSourceScreenshot : SaveSourceScreenshot
Saves a screenshot of a source to the filesystem.
The `imageWidth` and `imageHeight` parameters are treated as "scale to inner", meaning the smallest ratio will be used and the aspect ratio of the original resolution is kept.
If `imageWidth` and `imageHeight` are not specified, the compressed image will use the full resolution of the source.

Send-OBSCallVendorRequest : CallVendorRequest

A vendor is a unique name registered by a third-party plugin or script, which allows for custom requests and events to be added to obs-websocket.
If a plugin or script implements vendor requests or events, documentation is expected to be provided with them.
Send-OBSCallVendorRequest calls the OBS WebSocket with a request of type CallVendorRequest.

Sets a color filter
Adds or Changes a Color Correction Filter on an OBS Input.
This allows you to:
* Change Opacity on any source
* Correct gamma
* Spin the hue
* Saturate or Desaturate an image
* Change the contrast
* Brighten the image
* Multiply pixels by a color
* Add a color to all pixels
The opacity, as a number between 0 and 1.
The brightness, as a number between -1 and 1.
The constrast, as a number between -4 and 4.
The gamma correction, as a number between -3 and 3.
The saturation, as a number between -1 and 5.
The change in hue, as represented in degrees around a color cicrle
Multiply this color by all pixels within the source.
Add all this color to all pixels within the source.
If set, will remove a filter if one already exists. If this is not provided and the filter already exists, the settings of the filter will be changed.
Add all this color to all pixels within the source.
The brightness, as a number between -1 and 1.
The constrast, as a number between -4 and 4.
If set, will remove a filter if one already exists. If this is not provided and the filter already exists, the settings of the filter will be changed.
The gamma correction, as a number between -3 and 3.
The change in hue, as represented in degrees around a color cicrle
Multiply this color by all pixels within the source.
The opacity, as a number between 0 and 1.
The saturation, as a number between -1 and 5.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 2 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: Show-OBS -Uri https://pssvg.start-automating.com/Examples/Stars.svg | Set-OBSShaderFilter -FilterName "SeasickShader" -ShaderFile seasick -ShaderSetting @{ amplitude = 0.05 speed = 0.5 frequency = 12 opacity = 1 }

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 3 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: Show-OBS -Uri https://pssvg.start-automating.com/Examples/Stars.svg | Set-OBSShaderFilter -FilterName "TwistShader" -ShaderFile twist -ShaderSetting @{ center_x_percent=50 center_y_percent=50 power = 0.05 rotation = 80 }

VLC must be installed for this to work.
The path to the media file.

What to select in the playlist. If a number is provided, this will select an index. If a string is provided, this will select the whole name or last part of a name, accepting wildcards. If an `[IO.FileInfo]` is provided, this will be the exact file.
If set, will shuffle the playlist
If set, the playlist will loop.
If set, will show subtitles, if available.
The selected audio track number.
The selected subtitle track number.
The name of the scene. If no scene name is provided, the current program scene will be used.
The name of the input. If no name is provided, the last segment of the URI or file path will be the input name.
If set, will check if the source exists in the scene before creating it and removing any existing sources found. If not set, you will get an error if a source with the same name exists.
If set, will fit the input to the screen.
The selected audio track number.
The path to the media file.
If set, will fit the input to the screen.
If set, will check if the source exists in the scene before creating it and removing any existing sources found. If not set, you will get an error if a source with the same name exists.
If set, the playlist will loop.
The name of the input. If no name is provided, the last segment of the URI or file path will be the input name.
The name of the scene. If no scene name is provided, the current program scene will be used.

What to select in the playlist. If a number is provided, this will select an index. If a string is provided, this will select the whole name or last part of a name, accepting wildcards. If an `[IO.FileInfo]` is provided, this will be the exact file.
If set, will shuffle the playlist
If set, will show subtitles, if available.
The selected subtitle track number.

Waveform sources require the [Waveform Plugin](https://obsproject.com/forum/resources/waveform.1423/)
The width of the browser source. If none is provided, this will be the output width of the video settings.

The windowing mode for the waveform. This is the mathematical function used to determine the current "window" of audio data.
The color used for the waveform.
The crest color used for the waveform. This will be ignored if the render mode is not "gradient".
The channel mode for the waveform. This can be either mono or stereo.
The number of pixels between each channel in stereo mode

Adds or sets a window capture source
Adds or sets a windows capture source in OBS. This captures the contents of a window.
The monitor number. This the number of the monitor you would like to capture.
The number of the capture method. By default, automatic (0).
The capture priority.
If set, will capture the cursor. This will be set by default. If explicitly set to false, the cursor will not be captured.
If set, will capture the client area. This will be set by default.
If set, will force SDR.

The name of the input. If no name is provided, "Display $($Monitor + 1)" will be the input source name.

Stops obs-powershell effects.
Stops an effect in OBS PowerShell.
A running effect is a series of messages, and the obs-websocket does not let you cancel a message.
However, OBS effects can be bounced or running in a loop.
If these effects are stopped, they will not continue to loop or bounce.
The name of the effect.
